title: Riot, GP being disabled is getting old and apparently I can't be upset about it...
body:
It's been 3 days now (where I'm at) that I've not been able to play GP because of this "Lore" event. I have my reservations towards this actually happening but what gets me the most is that people find it "unreasonable" for us GP players to be Upset about it. We understand there's about 125+ more champions we can play, we really do understand that, but we want to play GP. I don't know what's so hard to understand about that nor do I understand why it's _wrong_ for us to be upset about it.  

I want my oranges, I want it to be K.

E: Riot if it's legitimately due to the bug, can you plainly state so and quit beating around the bush? This is griefing :\

Christ, what do I expect from people who think good writing is Graves and Twisted Fate going from murderous rivals to becoming buddies in a paragraph? Apparently too much.

I disagree. The scrimshaw scene for Gangplank was a big thing, something that would fit well in the grimdark setting of Warhammer 40k, which I take as the new Narrative Lead getting his hands dirty, as that was the bulk of his previous work. Starting in the ugly, dirty setting of Bilgewater, then transitioning into the seemingly perfect, high tech Piltover akin to his work making the Tau? It seems like hes doing what he knows while getting to know the lore.

Game of chess? Her last order so far was effectively burn the city, and it seems she wants a slow painful burn. Something, ironically, Gangplank himself would do just to prove a point. The rebel takes power and becomes the thing they once fought.

Maybe I am wrong, maybe after this everything will effectively shutdown again and nothing will build off it, maybe things won't change again. We shall see, I have high hopes for Graham McNeill.
